raw: * This is the base collection for all widgets and offers a good foundation
* for all widgets including enabled state handling, config and template storage
* and event handling to name a few key features.
* @require(qx.module.Dataset)
* @require(qx.module.util.String)
* @require(qx.module.event.Native)
* @group (Widget)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This is the base collection for all widgets and offers a good foundation for all widgets including enabled state handling, config and template storage and event handling to name a few key features.

raw: * Factory method for the widget which converts a standard
* collection into a collection of widgets.
* @return {qx.ui.website.Widget} A widget.
* @attach {qxWeb}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Factory method for the widget which converts a standard collection into a collection of widgets.

raw: * Creates a new collection from the given argument. This can either be an
* HTML string, a single DOM element or an array of elements
* @param html {String|Element[]} HTML string or DOM element(s)
* @return {qxWeb} Collection of elements

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates a new collection from the given argument. This can either be an HTML string, a single DOM element or an array of elements

@param.name: @param
@param.body: html {String|Element[]} HTML string or DOM element(s)

raw: * Fetches elements with a data attribute named data-qx-class
* containing the class name of the desired widget and initializes them as
* widgets.
* @param selector {String?} Optional selector expression or filter function to
* restrict the list of elements
* @attachStatic {qxWeb}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fetches elements with a data attribute named data-qx-class containing the class name of the desired widget and initializes them as widgets.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
selector {String?} Optional selector expression or filter function to
 restrict the list of elements
@param.description:
Optional selector expression or filter function to
 restrict the list of elements

raw: * Returns a wrapper Array that maps the widget API available on
* the first item in the current collection to all items in the
* collection.
* @attach {qxWeb}
* @return {qxWeb[]} Collection of widgets

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a wrapper Array that maps the widget API available on the first item in the current collection to all items in the collection.

raw: * Responsible for initializing of the widget. This checks for the data attribute
* named data-qx-class and initializes the widget if necessary.
* @return {Boolean} true if the widget has been initialized

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Responsible for initializing of the widget. This checks for the data attribute named data-qx-class and initializes the widget if necessary.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the widget has been initialized
@return.description: true if the widget has been initialized

raw: * Return the proper CSS prefix for the current widget. This prefix is
* based on the current classname.
* @return {String} The CSS prefix for the current object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the proper CSS prefix for the current widget. This prefix is based on the current classname.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} The CSS prefix for the current object.
@return.description: The CSS prefix for the current object.

raw: * Changes the enabled state of the current collection, which means all
* widgets in the collection. This sets the disabled attribute on the
* elements and all its children.
* @param value {Boolean} The enabled value.
* @return {qx.ui.website.Widget} The collection for chaining

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Changes the enabled state of the current collection, which means all widgets in the collection. This sets the disabled attribute on the elements and all its children.

raw: * Returns weather the first widget in the collection is enabled or not.
* @return {Boolean} The enabled state of the collection.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns weather the first widget in the collection is enabled or not.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} The enabled state of the collection.
@return.description: The enabled state of the collection.

raw: * Setter for the widget-specific templates. The available templates can
* be found in the documentation of the corresponding widget. The templates
* will be rendered using
* mustache.js.
* Please keep in mind to call {@link #render} after you change any
* template or config setting.
* @param name {String} The name of the template.
* @param template {String} The template string.
* @return {qx.ui.website.Widget} The widget instance for chaining.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Setter for the widget-specific templates. The available templates can be found in the documentation of the corresponding widget. The templates will be rendered using mustache.js. Please keep in mind to call {@link #render} after you change any template or config setting.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} The name of the template.

raw: * Setter for the widget-specific config. The available config settings can
* be found in the documentation of the corresponding widget. Each config
* setting can be set in the markup as data-attribute, prefixed with
* data-qx e.g. data-qx-length="5".
* Please keep in mind to call {@link #render} after you change any
* template or config setting.
* @param name {String} The name of the config setting.
* @param config {var} The value of the config setting.
* @return {qx.ui.website.Widget} The widget instance for chaining.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Setter for the widget-specific config. The available config settings can be found in the documentation of the corresponding widget. Each config setting can be set in the markup as data-attribute, prefixed with data-qx e.g. data-qx-length="5". Please keep in mind to call {@link #render} after you change any template or config setting.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} The name of the config setting.
@param.description: The name of the config setting.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: config {var} The value of the config setting.
@param.description: The value of the config setting.

raw: * Helper to set either config or template values.
* @param type {String} Either templates or config.
* @param name {String} The name for the value to store.
* @param data {var} The data to store.
* @return {qx.ui.website.Widget} The widget instance for chaining.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper to set either config or template values.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} The name for the value to store.
@param.description: The name for the value to store.

raw: * Returns the used template. This includes custom templates
* as the default templates defined by the widgets.
* @param name {String} The name of the template.
* @return {String} The template string or undefined.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the used template. This includes custom templates as the default templates defined by the widgets.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} The name of the template.

raw: * Returns the config setting currently in use for the given widget.
* This can either be the user set config value, the value set in
* the markup via data-attribute, the widgets default config value or
* undefined, if non is set.
* @param name {String} The name of the config.
* @return {var} The value of the config or undefined.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the config setting currently in use for the given widget. This can either be the user set config value, the value set in the markup via data-attribute, the widgets default config value or undefined, if non is set.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} The name of the config.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The value of the config or undefined.
@return.description: The value of the config or undefined.

raw: * Internal helper for querying the values for templates and configs. In the
* case of a config value, the method also reads the corresponding data-attribute
* for possible values.
* @param type {String} Either templates or config.
* @param name {String} The name for the value to fetch.
* @return {var} The value store for the given arguments.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Internal helper for querying the values for templates and configs. In the case of a config value, the method also reads the corresponding data-attribute for possible values.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: name {String} The name for the value to fetch.
@param.description: The name for the value to fetch.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The value store for the given arguments.
@return.description: The value store for the given arguments.

raw: * The render method is responsible for applying changed config
* and template settings. This method is usually overridden and specified
* by the subclassing widgets like the slider or tabs.
* @return {qx.ui.website.Widget} The widget collection for chaining.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The render method is responsible for applying changed config and template settings. This method is usually overridden and specified by the subclassing widgets like the slider or tabs.

raw: * Dispose the widget, making sure all objects are ready for
* garbage collection. This mainly means deleting connections to the
* DOM including event listeners.
* @return {qxWeb} Plain qxWeb collection

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Dispose the widget, making sure all objects are ready for garbage collection. This mainly means deleting connections to the DOM including event listeners.
